channel.title: Java SE Development Kit (JDK)
channel.description: Yeah, where can I get that for Macs? That's all I need, thanks.

item.title: Java SE Development Kit (JDK)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Rudolph, post:5, topic:258528”]Cant find it after 1-2 hours. Thanks anyways. Lets try a new question?
Im using a Mac right now. I have a .bat file (i think is only made for windows),
when I open it, it doesn’t run it like a .bat file should. Instead, it brings it up with
a program on Mac’s called textedit, where you can only read the .bat file, kind of like
the edit option for Windows to view/edit the .bat file. So basically how can I EXECUTE
the batch to where it works for me just like a Windows computer?

This is for a program called rsbot, I wanted to mess around with scripting and such,
and the instructions for it show this:

1. Download and install the Java SE Development Kit (JDK) from http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/ 2. Click on the file titled "Compile.bat" before you run the bot for the first time or update any scripts 3. (Optional) Download and install 7-Zip from http://www.7-zip.org/ 4. (Optional) For users downloading the .zip release install TortoiseSVN at http://tortoisesvn.net/ and obtain RSBot through Subversion

I’m guessing from what that shows, that I need to get Java updated, which I did from the link you provided.

So to wrap that all up, what’s my next step and do I need the Java SE Development Kit (JDK)? It’s also only for Windows, Linux, and some other computer.

Lol, that’s all, sorry for not summing that all up.[/quote]
That’s because .bat is the recognized batch scripting file for windows, iirc the one for Mac is applescript. You might need to convert it, shouldn’t be to hard I would imagine.

Read full topic

item.title: Java SE Development Kit (JDK)
item.dc:creator: @Rudolph Rudolph
item.description:
@Rudolph wrote:

Cant find it after 1-2 hours. Thanks anyways. Lets try a new question?
Im using a Mac right now. I have a .bat file (i think is only made for windows),
when I open it, it doesn’t run it like a .bat file should. Instead, it brings it up with
a program on Mac’s called textedit, where you can only read the .bat file, kind of like
the edit option for Windows to view/edit the .bat file. So basically how can I EXECUTE
the batch to where it works for me just like a Windows computer?

This is for a program called rsbot, I wanted to mess around with scripting and such,
and the instructions for it show this:

1. Download and install the Java SE Development Kit (JDK) from http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/ 2. Click on the file titled "Compile.bat" before you run the bot for the first time or update any scripts 3. (Optional) Download and install 7-Zip from http://www.7-zip.org/ 4. (Optional) For users downloading the .zip release install TortoiseSVN at http://tortoisesvn.net/ and obtain RSBot through Subversion

I’m guessing from what that shows, that I need to get Java updated, which I did from the link you provided.

So to wrap that all up, what’s my next step and do I need the Java SE Development Kit (JDK)? It’s also only for Windows, Linux, and some other computer.

Lol, that’s all, sorry for not summing that all up.

Read full topic

How to update the software on your Mac
